summary.para: This is a base class for supporting INotifyPropertyChanged

summary.para: Override this method to provide Get functionality

member.returns: Unless overridden, this function will always return null

summary.para: Calls OnPropertyChanged. This method does not make assignments. Override this method to make assignments.

summary.para: Calls RaisePropertyChanged to raise the PropertyChanged event

member.param: The name of the property which changed

summary.para: Raises the PropertyChanged event

member.param: The sender is the owner of the property
The name of the property which changed

summary.para: Provides a base class to automate the IsDirty, MarkAsClean and InitializeProperties functionality Note that this class inherits PropertyChangedNotifier for INotifyPropertyChanged support

member.name: P:W.PropertyHostNotifier.IsDirty
member.summary: Finds all Properties and checks their IsDirty flag
member.returns: True if any Property's IsDirty flag is true. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:W.PropertyHostNotifier.MarkAsClean
member.summary: Uses reflection to find all Properties and mark them as clean (call Property.MarkAsClean())

member.name: M:W.PropertyHostNotifier.#ctor
member.summary: Calls PropertyHostMethods.InitializeProperties so you don't have to

member.name: E:W.PropertyBase`2.ValueChanged
member.summary: Raised after Value has changed

member.name: E:W.PropertyBase`2.ValueChanging
member.summary: Raised before Value has changed. To prevent Value from changing set cancel to true.

member.name: M:W.PropertyBase`2.WaitForChanged(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows the caller to suspend it's thread until Value changes

member.name: M:W.PropertyBase`2.LoadValue(`1)
member.summary: Loads Value without raising events or calling the OnValueChanged callback
member.remarks: Calling LoadValue sets IsDirty to false
member.param: The new value

summary.para: Provides a base class to automate the IsDirty, MarkAsClean and InitializeProperties functionality Note that this class does not support INotifyPropertyChanged and is not intented to host owned properties (though nothing prevents you from doing so)

member.name: P:W.PropertyHost.IsDirty
member.summary: Finds all Properties and checks their IsDirty flag
member.returns: True if any Property's IsDirty flag is true. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:W.PropertyHost.MarkAsClean
member.summary: Uses reflection to find all Properties and mark them as clean (call Property.MarkAsClean())

member.name: M:W.PropertyHost.#ctor
member.summary: Calls PropertyHostMethods.InitializeProperties so you don't have to

member.name: T:W.PropertyHostMethods
member.summary: Exposes static PropertyHost extension methods

summary.para: Scans the fields and properties of "owner" and sets the member's Owner property to "owner" This method should be called in the constructor of any class which has IOwnedProperty members

member.name: M:W.PropertyHostMethods.IsDirty(System.Object)

summary.para: Scans the IsDirty value of each field and property of type IProperty

member.returns: True if any IProperty member's IsDirty value is true, otherwise false

summary.para: Scans each field and property of type IProperty and sets it's IsDirty flag to false

member.param: Abort the thread if it doesn't terminate before the specified number of milliseconds elapse

summary.para: Cancels the thread by calling Cancel on the CancellationTokenSource. The value should be checked in the code in the specified Action parameter.

member.param: Abort the thread if it doesn't terminate before the specified number of milliseconds elapse

member.name: M:W.Threading.Thread.Join
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the thread terminates

member.name: M:W.Threading.Thread.Join(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until either the thread terminates or the specified milliseconds elapse

member.returns: True if the thread terminates within the timeout specified, otherwise false
